metadata.feature_description: Retrieve global URL management configuration including locale settings and sorting options

steps.action: Login as SuperUser and navigate to Settings > SEO > URL Management
steps.expected: URL Management page loads with configuration settings visible
steps.actual: URL Management page loaded successfully showing GENERAL SETTINGS tab with URL Rewriter and URL Redirects configuration options

steps.expected: Configuration settings including locale options and URL settings are visible
steps.actual: Configuration settings displayed correctly: Standard Replacement Character ('-'), Concatenate Page URLs (On), Convert URLs to Lowercase (Off), Convert Accented Characters (Off), Set Default Site Language (On), Redirect options (404 Error/Site Home Page), Redirect to Friendly URLs (On), Redirect Mixed Case URLs (Off)

observations: The GetConfiguration() API endpoint in UrlManagementServiceController.cs (line 486-495) returns SingleLocale (boolean indicating single locale or content localization enabled) and SortingFields (enum values: None=0, Url=1, Locale=2, Status=3). This API is page-context specific and is used internally when managing custom URLs for individual pages.
The URL Management configuration visible in the SEO > URL Management UI displays site-wide URL settings that are powered by this configuration system.
The site has multiple locales enabled (English and Spanish), so SingleLocale would return false in this configuration.
Available sorting fields (None, Url, Locale, Status) are used for sorting URL lists when viewing custom page URLs.
